snippet: Salmon, once nearly extinct on part of the Columbia River, are slowly recovering, to the delight of birds. As a result, those charged with nursing the salmon back to robust health have a new plan to protect them: shoot the birds.
abstract: Debate has broken out over whether to shoot hordes of birds that feed on salmon in Columbia River in order to protect rebounding salmon population; some environmentalists have called killing off birds both unnecessary and inappropriate, but others see no other option.
lead_paragraph: Salmon, once nearly extinct on part of the Columbia River, are slowly recovering, to the delight of birds. As a result, those charged with nursing the salmon back to robust health have a new plan to protect them: shoot the birds.

headline.main: Taking Up Arms Where Birds Feast on Buffet of Salmon
headline.print_headline: Taking Up Arms Where Birds Feast on Buffet of Salmon
